key_points: Millions of seniors who didn't file a 2019 or 2020 tax return have started receiving their third stimulus checks.
The IRS began processing payments for about 30 million seniors after receiving data from the Social Security Administration (SSA) in late March.
Payments are generally being made in the same way recipients receive their regular Social Security benefits, mostly electronically.
Seniors receiving Social Security retirement benefits, SSDI, SSI, or RRB benefits who didn't file a 2019 or 2020 return are included.
Veterans receiving benefits from the Department of Veterans Affairs and who didn't file a recent tax return will also get payments soon.
Most beneficiaries do not need to take any action to receive their stimulus payment.
Some beneficiaries may need to file a 2020 tax return to claim additional funds for a spouse or dependents.
Every eligible American is set to receive a $1,400 base amount, with $2,800 for married couples and an extra $1,400 for each dependent.
Third stimulus checks will be phased out for individuals with higher adjusted gross incomes.
The deadline for filing a 2020 tax return has been extended to May 17, 2021.
